17:30.race_name: £99 Annual Pass Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Beaten only 2l when fourth of seven at Southwell last March; off since; makes yard debut
runners.name: Daddy Chill
runners.spotlight: Remote third on his debut last February but was beaten only 2l when fourth of seven at Southwell 307 days ago when last seen; has since left Andrew Balding, who still owns him; may be one for handicaps.

runners.comment: 0-12 but he has been placed nine times (6f-1m); didn't see things out over 6f here latest
runners.name: Gennadius
runners.spotlight: 0-12 but he has been placed nine times (6f-1m); didn't see things out here over 6f a week ago having got across from his wide stall; may come on for that first start since September but he may well prove vulnerable again returned to 1m.

runners.comment: 32,000gns yearling; closely related to 11.6f turf/1m4f AW winner; dam 1m4f/12.4f winner
runners.name: Hengist Pod
runners.spotlight: 32,000gns yearling; fourth foal; closely related to 11.6f turf/1m4f AW winner Valsad (RPR 99), half-brother to winners Valvano (1m 2yo; 102) and Battista (8.6f-1m1f including AW/KSA; 82); dam 1m4f turf/12.4f AW winner (88), half-sister to 1m2f Listed winner El Drama; interesting newcomer.

runners.breeder: Cornthrop Bloodstock Widden Stud Uk Pty
runners.comment: Related to AW winners but he beat only one rival home at Lingfield on debut 12 days ago
runners.name: Tonyfromhr
runners.spotlight: Related to winning sprinters on the AW but he beat only one rival home on his debut at Lingfield (1m; 100-30) 12 days ago; market suggested better was expected but he needs to take a big step forward.

runners.comment: Hung left but ran a promising race on his debut here over 7f in November; commands respect
runners.name: Variety Act
runners.spotlight: Ran a promising race here over 7f on his debut in November when beaten a neck by a Gosden newcomer, despite hanging to his left; now steps up to 1m and commands plenty of respect.

runners.comment: Finished ahead of Tonyfromhr on her debut at Lingfield but improvement is needed
runners.name: Dors Dazzler
runners.spotlight: Withdrawn after getting upset in the stalls on her intended debut at Kempton in August; finished ahead of Tonyfromhr when fifth of nine at Lingfield on her debut, albeit she was beaten 10l and improvement is needed.

runners.comment: Ran to a similar level in two starts at Kempton and Newcastle; may be one for handicaps
runners.name: Very Demure
runners.spotlight: Sixth of seven in a fillies' maiden at Kempton in August and she ran to a similar level when fifth at Newcastle (1m) 26 days ago; may do better when handicapping.

18:00.race_name: Chelmsford Mile Series Qualifying Handicap (Chelmsford Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: All four wins have been over 7f; returns to this yard having been off since August
runners.name: My Mate Mike
runners.spotlight: Won three times when previously with this yard and made all here for John Jenkins last April (all over 7f); couldn't muster the pace late on here over 6f in August and now returns to this stable having been off since; back on his last winning mark but may be at his best over slightly shorter than today's trip.

runners.comment: 0-12; hung right and seemed stretched by this trip at Southwell last time; blinkers go on
runners.name: Lexington Jet
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden who was beaten 4l when third here over 7f in November; hung right and seemed stretched by this trip at Southwell 27 days ago; hood/cheekpieces are removed and replaced by first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: Three-time winner (5f/6f); ran respectably over this trip last time; needs to back that up
runners.name: My Awele
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing CII And Partners
runners.spotlight: All three of her wins have been over shorter (5f/6f) but she did run respectably over this trip at Lingfield 12 days ago; claims if backing that effort up now dropped in grade.

runners.comment: Went down by only a neck at Wolverhampton last month and ran respectably 12 days ago
runners.name: Pitney
runners.spotlight: Has dropped a long way in the weights since returning for this yard last May and went down by only a neck at Wolverhampton (8.5f, AW) last month; ran another respectable race when fourth at Lingfield (1m, AW) 12 days ago and there's no reason why he shouldn't run another good race.

runners.comment: Dual AW winner but he had a couple of today's rivals ahead of him at Lingfield last time
runners.name: Union Island
runners.spotlight: Five of his six wins have come at about this trip, with two of them coming on the AW in December 2024; beat only one rival home here following a break last month and had a couple of today's rivals ahead of him at Lingfield 12 days ago.

runners.comment: Won a 7f maiden here for Alice Haynes; ran a solid race over 7f on his stable debut
runners.name: Blue Eclipse
runners.spotlight: Struggled in handicaps for Alice Haynes after winning a maiden here over 7f last January but he ran a solid race at Wolverhampton (7f; reported to have lost a shoe) on his stable debut 19 days ago, while leaving the impression that he's worth another go over this trip; contender.

runners.comment: Veteran; without a win on the AW since March 2023 but ran well when fourth at Lingfield
runners.name: Poetic Force
runners.spotlight: Veteran who took advantage of his lower turf mark when winning twice at Brighton (7f/1m) last summer; without a win on the AW since March 2023 but he left the impression he's returned from a break in good form when fourth at Lingfield five days ago.

runners.comment: Three wins on the Flat have been over 1m2f; cheekpieces replace the visor; trip a concern
runners.name: Fillyfudge
runners.spotlight: All three of her wins on the Flat have been over 1m2f; failed to beat a rival home at Southwell (1m3f, AW) in November but she ran a better race when fifth of 12 at Wolverhampton (9.5f, AW) 26 days ago; cheekpieces replace the visor but this is the shortest trip she has encountered since July 2023.

runners.comment: Never got involved here over 1m last time but beaten a head the time before; blinkers on
runners.name: My Boy Harry
runners.spotlight: Two wins last year, with the latest coming at Kempton (1m, AW; first-time visor) in October; beaten a head at Lingfield (7f, AW) last month but could never get involved here over 1m 13 days ago; blinkers are now applied.

runners.comment: Hasn't won for a while but he was running well prior to a lesser effort last time
runners.name: Kondratiev Wave
runners.spotlight: Can front-run; without a win since landing a Brighton handicap in October 2024 but he was running well prior to a lesser effort over this C&D four days ago; bounce back needed.

runners.comment: Three of his four wins have been at this track (6f/1m); below his best at Southwell latest
runners.name: Kessaar Power
runners.spotlight: Can front-run; three of his four wins have been at this track (6f/1m), with the most recent coming in October; below his best when fourth at Southwell (1m, AW) last time but that was his first start for 75 days and he may come on for it; can be competitive back to 7f.

runners.comment: 0-18 but was placed off higher marks last year; wide trip when fourth here four days ago
runners.name: Tootsie
runners.spotlight: 18-race maiden but she was placed off higher marks last year when trained by Tim Easterby; posted a respectable effort when fourth over C&D four days ago despite encountering a wide trip; unexposed for this yard and she holds claims.

runners.comment: 0-8; raced freely on her last two starts, including in the hood last time; back to 7f
runners.name: Straight Back Up
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who was held in fourth at Wolverhampton (8.5f, AW) in October; again raced freely, despite the hood being applied, at Lingfield (1m, AW) 29 days ago; drop back to 7f may help her settle.

runners.comment: Not been in the same form since finishing third at Southwell last April; drops back to 7f
runners.name: United Force
runners.spotlight: Won three times over 1m in 2024, including over C&D; third at Southwell (1m, AW) last April but he's not been in the same form in four starts since; drops back to 7f and others are preferred.

19:00.race_name: For The Love Of Horses Handicap

runners.comment: Chasing a hat-trick after two 6f wins at Lingfield; 2lb rise for latest looks manageable
runners.name: Lazzar
runners.spotlight: Didn't have to improve to win small-field 6f novice at Lingfield last month (runner-up won next time) and he showed better form when following up in a handicap back at Lingfield four weeks later; looked to have more in hand than the neck margin would suggest and a 2lb rise is manageable; strong claims.

runners.comment: Dangerous mark on her best form but quiet in two runs this winter; now tried in a visor
runners.name: Siobhanbrogan
runners.spotlight: Finished second in a 6f fillies' handicap at Wolverhampton last February when rated 4lb higher; not shone in two runs after an absence but down in the weights and the addition of a visor could give her a lift.

runners.comment: Achieved little in 2025, including on stable debut; plenty to prove
runners.name: Stapleford Park
runners.spotlight: Quiet in three runs for Charlie Fellowes last year and tailed off at Windsor on stable debut 136 days ago; plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Not at his best on last two starts and others bring more persuasive claims
runners.name: Massimo Blue
runners.spotlight: Back to winning ways at Southwell last October, his second run for this yard, when coming from off the pace to win a 6f Class 6 in good style; runner-up at Wolverhampton two days later but two runs since haven't been quite so good; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Drop back in trip looks the right move but needs to better earlier handicap runs to win
runners.name: Darn Hot Time
runners.spotlight: Some promise in three handicap runs, including her stable debut last month (8.6f, raced too freely), and this return to 6f should suit; others have more obvious claims though.

runners.comment: Exposed 15-race maiden; good 2nd off 1lb higher 11 days ago (7f); each-way claims again
runners.name: Invincible Melody
runners.spotlight: Exposed 15-race maiden; good second at Southwell 11 days ago (7f) and he can race off a 1lb lower mark today; each-way shout.

runners.comment: Handicapped to go well but he would be more appealing at 5f
runners.name: Buraback
runners.spotlight: Handicapped to go well and he ran a fair race over 5f here last month; that is his best trip though and he failed to back it up at Wolverhampton 13 days ago; others look stronger.

runners.comment: Needs luck in running but arrives in good form; this a better race than he usually tackles
runners.name: Vitalline
runners.spotlight: Style of racing leaves him a hostage to fortune but the cards fell right in a Kempton handicap last month (6f); another good run when second to an in-form opponent at Lingfield on Saturday; more required to take this higher-grade event from out of the weights.

runners.comment: Made it 6-7 at this track when winning here in September; solid claims back from a break
runners.name: Carlton
runners.spotlight: Made it 6-7 at this track when winning over C&D in September off a mark 3lb lower than today's; placed over hurdles at Fakenham and Huntingdon at around 2m4f on his next two starts; returns from a three-month break and holds good claims back here.

runners.comment: Didn't get home over 2m at Southwell last time; should be happier back down in trip
runners.name: Pleasant Man
runners.spotlight: Most recent win came at Southwell (1m6f, AW) last January on his final start for Lawrence Mullaney; didn't get home when fourth over 2m there last time (beaten 12l) and he should be suited by the drop back in trip, although others are more persuasive.

runners.comment: Well held at Wolverhampton on his latest start on the Flat; switches from hurdles
runners.name: Parramount
runners.spotlight: Sole win on the Flat came at Wolverhampton (1m6f, AW) in November 2024 off a 2lb higher mark than today's but he was well held on his return there two months ago; runner-up over hurdles at Doncaster on his next start before a respectable run at Ascot 27 days ago and now returns to the Flat; each-way chance.

runners.comment: Has won two of his last four starts; runner-up last time; trip is a slight unknown
runners.name: Must Believe
runners.spotlight: Has won two of his last four starts, most recently at Southwell (1m3f, AW) in November; posted another good effort when runner-up at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW) 26 days ago and he can again go well, although he still needs to fully prove his stamina for this far.

runners.comment: Struggled since winning at Newmarket in the summer; back in trip with plenty to prove
runners.name: Atlantic Sunset
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when visored for the first time at Newmarket (1m4f) in June but he's struggled in five starts since, three of which have been since being gelded; drops back in trip with plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Won at Kempton and Wolverhampton in October; posted two solid efforts since; up in trip
runners.name: Veraison
runners.spotlight: Won at Kempton (1m3f, AW) and Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW) in October; 4lb higher than the most recent of those wins but her last two efforts have been solid; up in trip.

runners.comment: 0-7; best two efforts have been over 1m4f at Newcastle; step up in trip is a concern
runners.name: Relocal
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden but he has been placed over 1m4f at Newcastle on two occasions, including in first-time blinkers 44 days ago; doesn't look to be crying out for this longer trip.

20:00.race_name: Free Racing All January Classified Stakes

runners.comment: Beaten a neck at Newcastle six days ago; unexposed over 5f and drops into a classified
runners.name: Bishops Glory
runners.spotlight: Won at Newcastle (6f, AW; first-time visor) in November on his second start for this yard; has been placed in both starts since dropping back to 5f, most recently when beaten a neck six days ago; leading contender now returned to classified company.

runners.comment: Unfortunate not to finish closer when fourth here over 6f a week ago; holds solid claims
runners.name: Flickas Girl
runners.spotlight: Both of her wins have been at Wolverhampton over 5f; returned to form following some lesser efforts and was unfortunate not to finish closer (met trouble) when fourth here over 6f a week ago; solid claims.

runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate II
runners.comment: Won twice in August, including over C&D; resurgent effort at Lingfield yesterday
runners.name: Global Effort
runners.spotlight: Won at Yarmouth (5f, good to firm) and over this C&D in August; hindered by wide trip on penultimate start, then posted a resurgent effort with rallying third at Lingfield (5f classified event) yesterday; could go well.

runners.comment: 28-race maiden but he's been in the first three 14 times; returns from a 104-day break
runners.name: Marcus
runners.spotlight: 28-race maiden but he has been in the first three on 14 occasions; off since finishing fourth of ten at Southwell (5f, AW) 104 days ago; may find one or two too good.

runners.comment: Well beaten in a handicap at Leicester in July and has now been unplaced in all ten starts
runners.name: Snow Boots
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in a handicap at Leicester (6f) in July and has now been unplaced in all ten starts; returns to 5f having been off since; others preferred.

runners.comment: 5-66 but without a win since July 2024; third at Bath last May but mostly struggled since
runners.name: Tilsworth Ony Ta
runners.spotlight: Has won five times in 66 starts, most recently at Lingfield in July 2024, but he's not been in the best form since finishing third at Bath (5f, firm) last May.

runners.comment: Ran well from the front when third at Lingfield over 7f five days ago; drops back in trip
runners.name: Under Curfew
runners.spotlight: 10yo whose most recent success came at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last February; ran well from the front when third at Lingfield (7f, AW) five days ago and he should be suited by dropping back in trip.

runners.comment: 2-17; failed to beat a rival home on his final start for Tim Easterby; AW/yard debut
runners.name: Bubbles Wonky
runners.spotlight: Gained his second success when winning at Hamilton (1m1f, good) in the summer and he went down by a neck there on soft ground in September; well beaten at Haydock (1m, good to soft) in October on his final start for Tim Easterby and now returns to 1m2f for his AW/stable debut (bought for 28,000gns).

runners.comment: Three-time winner over 1m4f; ran well when beaten a neck by Time Tested over C&D latest
runners.name: Melek Alreeh
runners.spotlight: All three of his wins have been over 1m4f, two of which were on the AW at Southwell; ran well on his first start for 101 days when beaten a neck by Time Tested over this C&D earlier in the month; 1lb better off with that rival and he should go well.

runners.comment: Maiden winner for Aidan O'Brien; returned to form over 2m last time; hood now applied
runners.name: Vice President
runners.owner: One More Moment Of Madness & Partners
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner at the third attempt for Aidan O'Brien in 2024; has dropped 8lb since joining this yard and returned to form in the returning cheekpieces (now left off) when a keeping-on third at Kempton (2m, AW) eight days ago; not sure to be suited by the drop back in trip and now has the hood added.

runners.comment: Progressive 5yo; took his C&D record to 3-3 when beating Melek Alreeh 13 days ago; up 2lb
runners.name: Time Tested
runners.spotlight: Progressive 5yo who was taking his record over C&D to 3-3 when beating Melek Alreeh here 13 days ago; could have even more to offer and is one of the leading contenders off this 2lb higher mark.

runners.breeder: Haras De Son Altesse LAga Khan Scea
runners.comment: Won over 1m4f on turf in France; tailed off in two starts for this yard; blinkers tried
runners.name: Rodoya
runners.spotlight: 1-3 on turf when trained in France, with the win coming at Compiegne over 1m4f last May, but she's been tailed off in two starts for this stable (1m6f/2m); down in trip with a major revival needed in first-time blinkers.

runners.breeder: Floors Stud Ltd & The Duke Of Devonshire
runners.comment: May have not been suited by soft ground on his handicap debut; gelded since last seen
runners.name: Desert Heart
runners.spotlight: Showed plenty of promise in three maiden/novice events over 7f-1m2f and he may have not been suited by soft ground at Ayr on his handicap debut 193 days ago; has been off since and returns having undergone a gelding operation ahead of his AW debut; watch the betting.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 5yo who made a winning handicap debut over 8.5f at Wolverhampton; up 3lb
runners.name: Monty Beau
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who was placed in all three qualifying races and he made a winning handicap debut at Wolverhampton (8.5f, AW) 31 days ago; up 3lb but he's open to further progress over this longer trip.

runners.comment: 0-10 but he's been runner-up on his last three starts, including over this C&D latest
runners.name: Hinchinbrooke
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but he's been runner-up on his last three starts, most recently when bumping into a subsequent winner over this C&D 28 days ago; solid claims with the cheekpieces retained.

runners.comment: C&D winner in 2024; built on his stable debut when third here last month; each-way claims
runners.name: War Chant
runners.spotlight: C&D winner when trained by Rae Guest and he built on his stable debut when third of eight here 28 days ago (behind Hinchinbrooke); each-way claims.

runners.comment: Gained his first win on the AW at Wolverhampton last time; 7lb higher in a tougher race
runners.name: Oman
runners.spotlight: Four-time turf winner who gained his first win on the AW when coming from off the pace to land a class 6 handicap at Wolverhampton 33 days ago; 7lb higher in this tougher race.

12:07.race_name: Flaked Oats Memorial Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Hereford winner at this trip; this is tougher off 6lb higher but heading the right way
runners.name: Golan Loop
runners.spotlight: Has won a point and a novice hurdle; suffered a near miss on chase debut but went one better in determined fashion at Hereford (3m1f, good to soft); this is tougher off 6lb higher but he's heading the right way.

runners.comment: Listed hurdle winner in France; makes stable/handicap debut after a break; watch market
runners.name: Mombasa
runners.spotlight: Listed winner over hurdles in France; well held in three hurdles for Philip Hobbs and then ran twice for Noel George and Amanda Zetterholm, again finishing well held in a Listed race on chase debut in October 2024; since changed hands for £30,000 and can no doubt do better, especially now raised in distance for handicap debut; the market needs checking.

runners.comment: Good fourth at Cheltenham before struggling faced with a stiff task last time
runners.name: Major Fortune
runners.spotlight: Prolific winner over hurdles; mixed results in six races over fences but this is easier than Haydock last time and he did return with an encouraging fourth on reappearance at Cheltenham (2m4f, good); won at up to an extended 3m1f over hurdles; respected in the new cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Only three runs back he went close in this last year off same mark; player if back on song
runners.name: Tommys Charm
runners.spotlight: Hasn't completed the last twice but only three runs back he went close in this race 12 months ago off the same mark; hard to discount given that piece of form.

runners.comment: Lightly raced gelding; makes chase/handicap debut and has the build for this game
runners.name: Gaelic Rambler
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Irish points; had wind surgery prior to finishing third then second in good-ground maiden hurdles over an extended 2m7f at Chepstow last spring (better effort first occasion); switches to fences for this handicap debut after a lengthy break but he's got the build to do excel as a chaser.

runners.comment: Winning hurdler who didn't jump well enough when favourite for his chase debut
runners.name: Maximum Offers
runners.owner: L H & A Snowden & Lady Keswick
runners.spotlight: Consistent winning hurdler; went close in his only point but didn't give himself a chance on chase/handicap debut by jumping moderately; sent off favourite then and he retains potential with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Good runs last twice but doesn't look ahead of her mark and stamina isn't guaranteed
runners.name: Clotilda
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler who has finished runner-up in four of her five races over fences, latterly over 2m3f and 2m4f (good to soft); doesn't look ahead of her mark and stamina for this far isn't guaranteed.

runners.comment: Let down by jumping on chase debut and again not at best returned to hurdling a month ago
runners.name: Not A Light
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 9yo; let down by his jumping on chase debut and again not at his best returned to hurdling a month ago (3m; in a first-time hood that's now discarded); now has a bit to prove.

12:42.race_name: Oddschecker Free Bets Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.comment: Beaten over 40l in a novice hurdle at Exeter in early December (good to soft; 100-1)
runners.name: Air Apparent
runners.owner: A Cocks T Johnson & P Downing
runners.spotlight: Beaten a shade over 40l in a novice hurdle at Exeter in early December (good to soft; 100-1).

runners.comment: Pulled up in a Fontwell maiden and then a 26l sixth at Hereford; one for handicaps
runners.name: Corner Forward
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in a Fontwell maiden and then a 26l sixth at Hereford; one for handicaps.

runners.comment: Has run well in all his maiden hurdles and he sets the standard here by some way
runners.name: Gaelic Pride
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner; runner-up behind good horses in his first two maidens and again ran well at Ascot where he didn't see out the longer 2m5f as well as the principals; his form sets the standard here.

runners.comment: Offered little in his two races over hurdles and he's probably one for handicaps
runners.name: Hadrianus
runners.spotlight: Very useful middle-distance performer for Charlie Johnston but he signed off for that yard on a downer; has offered little in his two races over hurdles and he's probably one for handicaps.

runners.comment: Little substance to his form in British points and makes no appeal on this rules debut
runners.name: Richforadaay
runners.spotlight: Little substance to his form in British points and makes no appeal on this rules debut.

runners.comment: Poor pointer and nothing to show for his two runs under rules
runners.name: Tobi Kanobee
runners.spotlight: Poor pointer and nothing to show for his two runs under rules, latterly his hurdling debut when 250-1.

runners.comment: Ex-Irish gelding; beaten 13l and quite eyecatching in a novice hurdle at Ludlow
runners.name: Unknown Entity
runners.spotlight: Didn't last long with Willie Mullins despite showing promise; however, he was quite eyecatching when beaten 13l at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) despite slipping on the final bend; whether he can live with Gaelic Pride is debatable but he's up to winning races.

runners.comment: 33-1 and didn't show much at all in a heavy-ground maiden at Exeter
runners.name: What A Dragon
runners.spotlight: 33-1 and didn't show much at all in a heavy-ground maiden at Exeter; different conditions here but an unlikely winner.

runners.comment: Tailed off in a Hereford bumper and completely tailed off in an Exeter novice hurdle
runners.name: Deauville Lady
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a Hereford bumper and completely tailed off in an Exeter novice hurdle.

runners.comment: Has had wind surgery since last run but no worthwhile form as yet, on the Flat or hurdling
runners.name: Cosmic Spirit
runners.spotlight: Has had wind surgery since last run but no worthwhile form as yet, on the Flat or hurdling.

runners.comment: Flat winner in France; quiet hurdle/British debut but may be capable of better than that
runners.name: One Island
runners.spotlight: Won a Flat race for newcomers at Le Mans (1m3f, good to soft) in May on his only start in France; dropped out tamely to be well beaten on hurdling debut at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft; 11-4); should be capable of better than that.

runners.comment: Three Flat wins but down the field in two AW races for current yard; hurdling debut
runners.name: Shielas Well
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner for Grant Tuer at up to 1m2f; down the field in two AW runs for this yard last month and unlikely to be featuring here on hurdling debut.

13:17.race_name: Oddschecker Free Bets Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.comment: Well-beaten 200-1 shot at Exeter last month
runners.name: Dragons And Demons
runners.spotlight: Unseated rider in early stages of debut in November and was a well-beaten 200-1 shot at Exeter (2m, good to soft) last month; hood removed after one use.

runners.comment: Pulled up at triple-digit odds on both hurdling starts for Jimmy Frost last January
runners.name: Eric Gorcombe
runners.spotlight: Pulled up at triple-digit odds on both hurdling starts for Jimmy Frost last January (2m/2m3f); makes stable debut after one-year absence.

runners.comment: Placed on all three hurdling starts in the autumn and ought to give another good account
runners.name: Liam Mera Kai
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground Warwick bumper last spring and was placed on all three hurdling runs this autumn, most recently when close second at Southwell (2m, good to soft; unraced on slower); ought to give another good account.

runners.comment: Showed some promise on hurdling debut but needs a big step forward today
runners.name: Montrachet Fin
runners.spotlight: With a good stable and showed some promise when sixth (albeit well held in the end) on hurdling debut at Exeter (2m, good to soft) six weeks ago but needs to take a big step forward today.

runners.comment: Not beaten far on bumper debut but tailed off since; now switches to hurdling
runners.name: Regal Icon
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far when fifth of eight in good-ground course bumper on debut in November but tailed off at Exeter (soft) last month; now makes his hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Second in a Listed bumper in November and looks a good prospect for novice hurdles
runners.name: Sinchi Roca
runners.spotlight: Won heavy-ground bumper for Anthony Charlton last season and was second in Listed Cheltenham bumper (soft) on debut for Syd Hosie in November; below that form in another Listed bumper last month but remains a good prospect for novice hurdles.

runners.comment: Back from long absence with two creditable seconds last month; leading contender
runners.name: Wolf Walker
runners.owner: Robert Fear And Mrs Tracey Ham
runners.spotlight: Won three points in 2023-24 season and returned from long absence with creditable seconds over hurdles at Hereford (2m, good to soft) and Haydock (1m7f, good) last month; not sure to be suited by the forecast rain but still a leading contender.

runners.comment: Well beaten in both bumpers and when 150-1 for hurdling debut
runners.name: Grey Aquila
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in both bumpers and when 150-1 for hurdling debut; can't be recommended.

runners.comment: Flopped badly on recent British debut but can still deliver on promise shown in France
runners.name: Innamorato
runners.spotlight: Runner-up three times on the Flat in France and made the frame in both hurdling starts there; flopped badly when warm favourite for recent British debut but that run was patently too bad to be true; has cheekpieces refitted today; no surprise if he redeems himself.

runners.comment: Struggled on both hurdling attempts last month
runners.name: Launceston
runners.owner: S Keable L Cullimore G Tuck
runners.spotlight: Placed in a low-grade Flat handicap last June but struggled on both hurdling attempts last month.

runners.comment: Began career with two fairly encouraging runs but needs significant improvement
runners.name: Athenas Dream
runners.spotlight: Began career with two fairly encouraging runs against other fillies (bumper/hurdle) but needs significant improvement to pose a threat.

runners.comment: Ran well to a point in two juvenile hurdles last month but needs to learn to settle better
runners.name: Ritaan
runners.spotlight: Showed some fair form during three-race Flat career for a different stable last year and ran well to a point in two juvenile hurdles last month but needs to learn to settle much better.

13:52.race_name: Get The Best Odds With Oddschecker Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Showed only minor promise in maiden/novice hurdles; improvement required
runners.name: Jackomy
runners.spotlight: Unexposed after only three rules runs but showed nothing more than minor promise in his three qualifying runs (2m-2m4f) and needs to improve to pose a threat on this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Placed twice over hurdles last term but both handicap runs in November were disappointing
runners.name: Mistress Emma
runners.spotlight: Won a bumper in 2022 and returned from long absence with two promising hurdle runs last winter but her two handicap runs in November were disappointing and it takes a leap of faith to support her here.

runners.comment: Ran well in higher-grade C&D race on Boxing Day; one to consider
runners.name: Ugo Bingo
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent 7yo who ran well before fading into fourth over C&D (1m7f, good to soft; first-time cheekpieces) on Boxing Day; eased in grade today but ground slower than good to soft would be new to him.

runners.comment: Always behind in last two qualifying races but there was clear promise on his hurdle debut
runners.name: Run Away Joe
runners.spotlight: Always behind in his last two qualifying races but shaped with significant promise before last-flight mishap on hurdling debut at Ludlow (2m, good) in November and remains open to improvement on this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Convincing winner on heavy ground last month; unlucky to come to grief on next outing
runners.name: Morning Mayhem
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on first two stable starts but came good with clear win at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) last month; unlucky to be brought down in early stages of latest race, and will need to be taken very seriously if the ground deteriorates.

runners.comment: Scored over C&D in November; still on workable mark but forecast rain a worry
runners.name: Western Soldier
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D (good) in November, despite racing too freely, and can probably be excused subsequent 2m4f defeat here (looked a non-stayer); drops back in trip today and remains on a workable mark but the forecast rain is not in his favour.

runners.comment: Shock winner of claimer last month and followed up in big-field handicap; respected
runners.name: No Guarantee
runners.spotlight: Improved to cause 33-1 shock in Ludlow claimer (2m, good to soft) last month, his third stable start, and followed up with clearcut success in 15-runner Hereford handicap (2m, soft) just before Christmas; went up another 8lb for that but commands respect in current mood.

runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles but ended 2025 with two respectable runs; not ruled out each-way
runners.name: St Lukes Chelsea
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles but ended 2025 with two respectable fifths on good ground (one over C&D) and ought to cope if the ground turns soft (unraced on heavy); not ruled out each-way.

runners.comment: Improving 5yo who returned from break with two wins in late 2025; must be considered
runners.name: Postponed Legacy
runners.spotlight: Improving 5yo who returned from a break with two wins (both 2m, good to soft; unraced on anything slower) towards the end of last year; hiked up 10lb since Uttoxeter last time but he darted clear on the run-in there and must be considered.

runners.comment: Two wins (one over C&D); might have needed last month's run; Sean Bowen booked
runners.name: Just Aidan
runners.spotlight: Struck form with two wins (good to soft/heavy, one over C&D) in early 2025 and last month's reappearance run was not devoid of encouragement (even though he was pulled up in the end); Sean Bowen moves in for the ride today; could have a say if that recent outing brought him in.

runners.comment: Needs to better recent efforts but won't mind what the weather does
runners.name: Mr Zee
runners.spotlight: Not at his best on his two hurdling starts towards end of last year but now 1lb lower than when winning at Ludlow (2m, good) last spring and won't mind what the weather does.

runners.comment: Ran well here two starts ago but is 0-16 over hurdles; others preferred
runners.name: Freddie Fleetfoot
runners.spotlight: Gave good account when close fourth over C&D (good; also suited by soft) in November but was below that form at Taunton last month and is now 0-16 over hurdles; 1lb wrong; others preferred.

runners.comment: Ran well for a long way over C&D on Boxing Day but overall profile remains unconvincing
runners.name: Talap
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles; ran well for a long way when eighth from out of the weights over C&D (good to soft) on Boxing Day and is effectively 10lb lower today but his overall profile remains unconvincing.

14:27.race_name: Bet Smarter With Oddschecker+ Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Finished clear of the third at Kempton so a 4lb rise could have been worse
runners.name: King Of The Road
runners.spotlight: Surprising to see the cheekpieces left off as they were on for the first time when pushing an improver close at Kempton (2m5f, good; all wins on good to soft); he was 12l clear of the third so a 4lb rise could have been worse; respected.

runners.breeder: G Garcon J Garcon & I Garcon
runners.comment: Not in top form in two handicaps (at about 2m) since returning from lengthy absence
runners.name: Meatloaf
runners.owner: The Stewart Family Sira Ferguson & G Mason
runners.spotlight: Not in top form in two handicaps (at about 2m) since returning from lengthy absence and wind surgery; this could be more his trip but he has questions to answer now.

runners.comment: Just his seventh start when showing improved form to win 2m handicap at Doncaster; up 5lb
runners.name: Light Fandango
runners.spotlight: Just his seventh start when showing improved form to win a 2m handicap at Doncaster (good) 17 days ago; won his novice on soft ground and a 5lb rise for last time isn't too scary; should stay this far and be involved.

runners.comment: 3-8 over hurdles and might still be on a competitive mark; did cut out quickly on comeback
runners.name: Valadon
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-8 over hurdles and might still be on a competitive mark; he could also strip fitter for his comeback run at Exeter (2m2f), for all that he cut out a bit too quickly for comfort.

runners.comment: This is likely to take more winning than the Leicester race and he's 4lb higher
runners.name: One Eye On Vegas
runners.spotlight: Won a Leicester handicap (2m4f, soft) for the second season running in early December; the front two were clear but the second has disappointed since; this is likely to take more winning and he's 4lb higher.

runners.comment: Didn't run too badly in the new visor at Cheltenham but will need to back that up
runners.name: Moutarde
runners.spotlight: Four wins divided between the Flat and hurdling; didn't run too badly in a first-time visor at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft) but may have been flattered by how that race panned out (soon led); others perhaps safer.

runners.comment: Ex-Irish maiden who been pulled up and tailed off in his two handicaps for this yard
runners.name: Doctor Glide
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who been pulled up and tailed off in his two handicaps for this yard, at 66-1 on both occasions.

runners.comment: More exposed than some and he'll need to run a lot better than he did here a month ago
runners.name: Teorie
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner but more exposed than some in here and he'll need to run a lot better than he did here a month ago.

runners.comment: Raced five times and had two wind ops; still brings potential into handicaps
runners.name: Choice Runner
runners.spotlight: Second at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) before running well for a long way at Leicester (2m4f, soft); a tad worrying that he's only raced five times and yet had two wind operations, but brings potential into handicaps.

runners.breeder: Sca La Perigne Ecurie Du Chene Roger-Y
runners.comment: Lightly raced; just missed out on handicap debut; raised only 1lb and up in trip here
runners.name: Le Soleil Reve
runners.spotlight: Hereford winner (soft) who very nearly made a successful handicap debut at Exeter (2m, good to soft); only 1lb higher and could benefit from this longer trip.

runners.comment: 13l third to the smart Baron Noir last time; could be on a fair mark for handicap debut
runners.name: Purple Owl
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; has been racing prominently and didn't have it all his own way when a 13l third behind the smart Baron Noir (won last weekend) at Uttoxeter a month ago (first-time tongue-tie); stays this far and might be on a fair mark for handicap debut.

runners.breeder: Haras De La Haie Neuve Sas Regnier
runners.comment: Consistent prior to last time and he's twice run well under the returning Harry Cobden
runners.name: Lucky Bere
runners.spotlight: Two Flat wins in France; 0-6 over hurdles; third to the useful French Emperor in a good-ground handicap at Worcester in October but was beaten further by the same horse on soft at Cheltenham (handles those conditions); consistent prior to that and he's twice run well under the returning Harry Cobden.

15:02.race_name: Oddschecker Cheltenham Free Bets Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Useful novice but has shown very little since returning from a long absence
runners.name: Diamond Ri
runners.spotlight: His novice hurdle form reads well but he went absent for 590 days and has shown very little since returning, albeit in just two races; cheekpieces tried.

runners.comment: Ran his best race since joining David Pipe when a rallying third at Ascot (2m5f)
runners.name: Punta Del Este
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on form shown for Dan Skelton and ran his best race since joining David Pipe when a rallying third at Ascot (2m5f, soft); this return to further is worth exploring.

runners.comment: Old form offers hope but he's achieved nothing in his last six races
runners.name: Emailandy
runners.spotlight: Running well in good handicaps two years ago but he's had a couple of lengthy absences in the meantime and achieved nothing in his last six races.

runners.comment: Figures of 112 since handicapping and he looks a stayer on the upgrade
runners.name: Turndlightsdownlow
runners.spotlight: Kicked off his handicap career with back-to-back wins over 2m5f on good ground at Kempton and was clear of the rest when going close at Sandown (2m7f, soft); raised 6lb for that defeat but he's a stayer on the upgrade; partnered by Freddie Keighley (with his claim) in last three races.

runners.comment: Mark continues to fall but a bit to prove right now and stamina is unproven
runners.name: Rubber Ball
runners.spotlight: Useful novice last season, winning on soft; ran well for a long way at Aintree (2m4f, soft) in early December but again didn't see it out over that C&D when well held on Boxing Day; mark continues to fall but a bit to prove right now and stamina is unproven.

runners.comment: 3m1f maiden hurdle winner; didn't jump well on chase/handicap debut the last time
runners.name: Tommy The Tank
runners.spotlight: Did well as a novice hurdler, winning a 3m1f maiden at Hereford; jumping failed to stand the test at Sandown on his chase debut and now tackling his first handicap over hurdles; could go well.

runners.comment: Has more on his plate than at Lingfield but he could be a young stayer going places
runners.name: A Perfect Day
runners.spotlight: He's up in grade but it was only his third run under rules when well on top in a 2m7f handicap at Lingfield (good to soft); essentially 11lb higher for this as he went up 6lb and they claimed 5lb; still respected.

runners.breeder: S A R L Ecurie Haras De Quetieville
runners.comment: Disappointed at Newbury in late November but that was his first blip in handicaps
runners.name: Loverdose
runners.spotlight: Disappointed at Newbury in late November but that was his first blip in handicaps, having previously posted form figures of 1121122 (from 2m to 2m4f; unraced over further); has got himself high in the weights but if back on song he'd have each-way claims if staying the trip.

runners.comment: Under the pump a long way out when no match for an easy winner at Uttoxeter
runners.name: Oh My Johnny
runners.owner: Richard Johnson Racing- Oh My Johnny
runners.spotlight: Dual winner who is lightly raced; however, he was no match for an easy winner last time at Uttoxeter (2m7f, soft) and that was hard work having been under the pump a long way out.

runners.comment: Improved form last time at Chepstow (2m7f) when losing out narrowly
runners.name: Champagne Chic
runners.spotlight: Raised significantly in trip this season with both runs over 2m7f (in new cheekpieces) and showed much improved form last time at Chepstow (good to soft) when losing out narrowly; good chance off 4lb higher.

15:37.race_name: Download The Oddschecker App Somerset National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Third in last season's Scottish National; might be sharper for his Ascot completion
runners.name: Our Power
runners.spotlight: Has held his own in many a strong handicap, including when third in last season's Scottish National; fell early on his return so it was effectively his first race this campaign when possibly needing it at Ascot (3m5f); he's not without hope armed with his rider's 7lb claim.

runners.comment: Inconsistent but returned to action with a near miss at Carlisle in November
runners.name: Iron Bridge
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been easy to predict but a capable stayer on his day and returned to action with a near miss at Carlisle in November (3m2f, good to soft); the subsequent break is probably a good thing and needs considering.

runners.comment: Razed lazily but stuck to his guns to be second at Ludlow; interesting now visored
runners.name: Destroytheevidence
runners.spotlight: Beat Haiti Couleurs on his chase debut last season when Isaac Des Obeaux was further back and mostly ran well afterwards; probably needed his first race of the season and he stuck to his task to go down by only a length at Ludlow (3m, good to soft); gives the impression he'll stay all day and a visor could work (replacing cheekpieces; looked lazy at times on that final run).

runners.comment: Always been a good horse and off the mark over fences with some authority at Exeter
runners.name: Isaac Des Obeaux
runners.owner: G Mason Sir A Ferguson C & G Barber
runners.spotlight: Beat none other than Haiti Couleurs in a novice hurdle; took six goes to get off the mark over fences but he was nicely on top at Exeter in beating Operation Manna by 5l (3m, heavy); only an 8yo and things are picking up by the looks; raised 6lb.

runners.comment: He's pulled up and finished last in two races after a year on the sidelines
runners.name: Rapper
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on what he was doing two years ago but he's pulled up and finished last in two races after a year on the sidelines.

runners.comment: 5-12 over hurdles; second to Isaac Des Obeaux on chase debut; sent further here
runners.name: Operation Manna
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 10yo who was 5-12 over hurdles; having his first race over fences when a 5l second to Isaac Des Obeaux at Exeter (3m, heavy) where he needed some driving but kept on well; this stiffer stamina test could be up his street.

runners.comment: Very solid in defeat this campaign, holding his own in Class 2s the last twice
runners.name: Rivers Corner
runners.spotlight: Won a novice handicap last season over nearly 3m; very solid in defeat this campaign, holding his own in Class 2s the last twice (3m4f/3m2f); his mark hasn't budged an inch and every chance of being seriously involved.

16:10.race_name: Oddschecker+ With Predictive Ai 'Newcomers' National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

runners.comment: £110,000 3yo and half-brother to five winners including the smart Authorised Speed
runners.name: Beau Speed
runners.spotlight: £110,000 3yo and half-brother to five winners including Authorised Speed (useful bumper and 2m/2m3f hurdle) and Speedy Speed (French 1m4f/2m Flat and 2m hurdle); dam French 1m2f-12.5f winner; of obvious interest given his connections.

runners.comment: Out of a sister to high-class chaser Nacarat and stable gets bumper winners
runners.name: Dunstall Star
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 1m7f/2m chase winner Dunstall Rambler; dam unplaced in French bumpers but a sister to high-class staying chaser Nacarat; stable gets bumper winners.

runners.comment: Dam unraced sister to smart jumper Out Sam; sports headgear for debut
runners.name: Elusive Pb
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam unraced sister to smart jumper Out Sam, half-sister to useful bumper/jumps winner Honest John; wears headgear on debut; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Half-brother to five winners including this season's smart novice chaser Regent's Stroll
runners.name: Fine Tuning
runners.spotlight: 86,000euros 3yo; half-brother to five winners including this season's smart novice chaser Regent's Stroll; dam unraced half-sister to Denman; lots to like on paper and his yard has plenty of success in bumpers; tongue tied.

runners.comment: Brother to the stable's high-class bumper and 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Dashel Drasher
runners.name: Lingering Glance
runners.spotlight: Brother to the stable's high-class bumper and 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Dashel Drasher; dam won five points and placed in a bumper; could be interesting.

runners.comment: 4,500euros foal; first foal out of a bumper/2m2f hurdle winner; tongue tied
runners.name: Murphys Mate
runners.spotlight: 4,500euros foal; first foal out of a bumper/2m2f hurdle winner; stable has a respectable record in these races so he's another to monitor in the betting; tongue tied.

runners.comment: Nicely bred and in a top yard that won this bumper 12 months ago
runners.name: Shady Knight
runners.spotlight: Out of a 2m hurdle/chase winner and half-sister to useful winners Real Stone (2m-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Stoney's Teasure (2m3f-3m hurdle/chase); in a top yard that won this 12 months ago.

runners.comment: £20,000 3yo; tenth foal; closely related to 2m3f hurdle winner Barntown
runners.name: Trojan Tale
runners.owner: R H J Martin And Anna Harris
runners.spotlight: £20,000 3yo; tenth foal; closely related to 2m3f hurdle winner Barntown and half-brother to four winners including Flash The Steel (bumper and useful 2m-2m4f hurdle) and Doctor Duffy (bumper and useful 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase); dam unraced; yard 0-4 in bumpers recent seasons; can be taken on.

runners.comment: £32,000 3yo; fifth foal; brother to point winner Cherry Brave
runners.name: Valiant Soldier
runners.spotlight: £32,000 3yo; fifth foal; brother to point winner Cherry Brave; dam bumper winner/placed in 2m hurdles, half-sister to winners Teescomponents Lad (useful 2m3f-3m1f hurdle) and Tesscomponentsyess (bumper and 2m3f/2m4f hurdle/chase); bred to have a future.

runners.comment: Stable 0-5 in bumpers in recent seasons and this could be a decent race
runners.name: Up The Hill
runners.owner: Mrs K Jeanes & Mrs P Walker
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 2m3f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Chocca Wocca (bumper/2m1f hurdle) and As I See It (2m7f/3m1f hurdle); stable 0-5 in bumpers in recent seasons and this could be a decent race in which she makes her debut.

runners.comment: 8,000euros foal; 2nd foal; dam unraced half-sister to point/2m hurdle winner Little Token
runners.name: Scaredofnothing
runners.spotlight: 8,000euros foal; second foal; dam unraced half-sister to point/2m hurdle winner Little Token, out of a bumper and 2m hurdle/2m3f chase winner; stable's bumper runners always worth a second look.

11:45.race_name: Virgin Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.breeder: Mrs R Dawson & Miss A Dawson
runners.comment: 3rd in bumper at Sedgefield on second start; might have an each-way squeak on hurdle debut
runners.name: Art Dancer
runners.spotlight: Improved upon debut run when 6l third of six in bumper at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) last month; he might have an each-way squeak if taking another step forward on this first hurdle start.

runners.comment: Hurdle debut; unable to make an impact in his two bumpers and others are preferred
runners.name: Big Jon
runners.spotlight: Hurdle debut; unable to make an impact in his two bumpers (soft/good to soft) and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Placed on both hurdle starts and sets a good standard for the rest to aim at
runners.name: Gaelic Rover
runners.spotlight: Third on hurdle debut at Ayr (2m, soft) in November and again showed promise when runner-up over C&D (good to soft) later that month; sets a good standard for the rest to aim at.

runners.comment: Has shown some ability but not enough to suggest he's the one to be on today
runners.name: Intenzo
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability when 20l third at Catterick on New Year's Day (1m7f, good; second start) but not enough to suggest he's the one to be on today.

runners.breeder: Al Rabban Racing/Lope De Vega Syndicate
runners.comment: 3-time Flat winner at an ordinary level; down the field at Sedgefield on sole hurdle start
runners.name: Made All
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner at an ordinary level; open to improvement on second hurdle start but he was down the field at 16-1 at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) last month and it's probably best to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Sold for £100,000 after bumper win; could play a leading role on hurdle/stable debut
runners.name: So Proud
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground bumper at Haydock last May on sole start for Don Cantillon; sold for £100,000 later that month; open to progress and could play a leading role on hurdle debut, especially if the market speaks favourably.

runners.comment: Potential in pedigree; market check advised but he may be one for further down the line
runners.name: Swingforthefence
runners.spotlight: 16-5 when 9l third of five on debut in bumper at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) last April; there's potential in his pedigree and a market check is advised on hurdle debut but he may be one for further down the line.

runners.comment: Hasn't posed a threat on his two starts; may be of greater interest when upped in trip
runners.name: Takeyoutotheisland
runners.spotlight: Hasn't posed a threat on his two starts and his pedigree hints he'll be of greater interest when upped in trip.

runners.comment: Became disappointing on the Flat but hurdle debut third gives him something to build on
runners.name: Whos Glen
runners.spotlight: Became disappointing on the Flat but useful at his best in that code and last month's hurdle/stable debut third at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft) gives him something to build on; could be in the mix.

runners.comment: Well beaten on last month's bumper debut & same story when 80-1 over hurdles at Catterick
runners.name: Berwick Law
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on last month's bumper debut and same story when 80-1 in novice hurdle at Catterick (1m7f, good) subsequently.

runners.comment: No threat in either bumper and likewise on hurdle debut at Wetherby on Boxing Day
runners.name: Midnight Bella
runners.owner: G R Orchard And C Clarke
runners.spotlight: No threat in either bumper and likewise on hurdle debut at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) on Boxing Day; dramatic improvement is necessary.

runners.comment: Some useful form on the Flat but soundly beaten on recent hurdle debut at Catterick
runners.name: Roarin Success
runners.owner: Hale Racing Lyle Farming Company & Ptnr
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner with some useful form in that code; however, well beaten on last two Flat starts and soundly beaten when sixth of seven on recent hurdle debut at Catterick (1m7f, good); has to raise her game.

12:15.race_name: Virgin Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.comment: Had wind op before his promising third at Catterick (2m3f); in the mix back in trip
runners.name: Alba Crus
runners.spotlight: Won a bumper at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good) in June on second start; tailed off on hurdle debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft) in November but, after wind surgery, he bounced back with a promising third at Catterick (2m3f, good to soft) last month; now drops back in trip but he travelled smoothly for a long way last time and he's in the mix.

runners.comment: Well held at big prices in two bumpers and is best watched on hurdling debut
runners.name: Blazing Echo
runners.spotlight: Well held off at big prices in two bumpers in the autumn and is best watched on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Won a bumper at this track and he needs a close look on hurdling debut
runners.name: Freddie Steady Go
runners.owner: Castle View A Bell S Oliver & M Severs
runners.spotlight: Won on bumper debut here (2m1f, good) in April and he's finished a close third on both starts since (1m7f/2m, good); out of a 2m hurdle winner and he needs a close look on this switch to jumping; tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Point/bumper winner who ran well over hurdles at Taunton last month; respected
runners.name: Is This For Real
runners.spotlight: Won a British point (2m4f) on soft and a Kelso bumper (2m) on good to soft; held in fourth in both hurdle runs but was beaten only about 3l at Taunton (2m, good) last month and he probably would have gone close if he didn't make some late mistakes; strongly respected.

runners.comment: 0-5 in Irish points and was well held in a bumper last month; opposable on hurdling debut
runners.name: Karma De Cotte
runners.spotlight: Mixed record in Irish points (P6PU2) and was well held in a Musselburgh bumper (1m7f, good to soft) on rules debut last month; looks opposable now switched to hurdling.

runners.comment: Useful at his best on the Flat and he needs watching in market on hurdling debut
runners.name: Lyric
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo; well beaten in May on sole Flat start for this yard but he has some useful form in that sphere and he brings potential to this hurdle debut; interesting to see how he goes in the betting.

runners.comment: Runner-up in two bumpers and was fair third on hurdling debut in November; could go well
runners.name: Noble George
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two of his three bumpers last season and he made an encouraging start over hurdles when 6l third at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) three weeks ago; this is a deeper race but he should benefit from that reappearance run and he's effective on slow ground; could go well.

runners.breeder: Hoguenet C Guy Nbb Racing C German
runners.comment: Well held in all five runs and he needs improvement with hood added
runners.name: Siege Of Acres
runners.spotlight: Well beaten fourth in two Irish points; finished in rear in sole bumper and he's been well held switched to hurdling in last two starts; still early days but he needs improvement on this drop back in trip; hood added.

runners.comment: Some promise over hurdles but he needs more progress back at this trip
runners.name: Walk On Son
runners.spotlight: Promising third in a Carlisle novice (2m1f, good) in October but he failed to build on that when a never-dangerous fourth here (2m4f, good to soft) the following month; that took his record to 0-6 and he needs to kick on again back at this trip.

runners.comment: Good second on hurdling debut at Wetherby and sets the standard on that form; key player
runners.name: Madame La Papillon
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who reappeared for new yard with a promising second on hurdling debut at Wetherby (2m, soft) last month; that was behind a useful prospect who made all and she sets the standard on that eyecatching effort; key player.

runners.comment: Won an Irish point but was tailed off on hurdling debut in November; others preferred
runners.name: Nevershedatear
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point last spring but only two completed in that race and she was tailed off on hurdling debut at Doncaster (2mf, soft) in November; others preferred.

runners.comment: Won three of his last five Flat runs; needs watching in market on hurdling/stable debut
runners.name: Rupert The Prince
runners.spotlight: Won three of his last five Flat runs for Paddy Butler, including a clearcut success at Bath (2m1f, soft) in October; that was a Class 6 handicap but he changed hands for 36,000gns after that and he should have a future at this new discipline; needs watching in market on hurdling debut.

12:50.race_name: Border Minstrel Sunday Lunch Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Series Qual') (GBB)

runners.comment: Thriving over hurdles this term, and this switch to fences may unlock further improvement.
runners.name: Glen Road
runners.spotlight: Thriving over hurdles following wind surgery this season, winning twice, both on soft ground, and ran perfectly well when a close fourth at Wetherby on Boxing Day off this mark; handicapper may now have his measure, but this switch to fences could unlock further improvement.

runners.comment: Produced a career best over fences at Wetherby latest and likely to go well again.
runners.name: Joecooker
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner who is progressing well over fences this season and latest effort was a career best when a close second at Wetherby (extended 2m3f, soft) on Boxing Day with a tongue-tie added; likely to go well again.

runners.comment: Appeals as the type to do better over fences but recent form gives him a bit to prove.
runners.name: Jus De Citron
runners.spotlight: Doncaster novice hurdle winner on rules debut in December 2024 but well held in two runs since, albeit 322 days apart, most recently on handicap debut at Kempton (2m5f, good) on Boxing Day following wind surgery; that run may have been needed and he does appeal as the type to do better over fences, but he does come here with a bit to prove.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De St Maur
runners.comment: Yet to fire since switched to fences this campaign, but could improve for the longer trip.
runners.name: Quantock Hills
runners.spotlight: Dual juvenile hurdle last season who had his limitations exposed in some deeper races at the turn of the year, but he signed off with a respectable fifth in a Sandown (2m, good) handicap in April; yet to really fire since switched to fences this term for a stable going well, though he could improve for this longer trip.

runners.comment: Went close to getting straight off the mark over fences at Kelso; longer trip will suit.
runners.name: Moon Phases
runners.spotlight: £150,000 buy after finishing fourth in an Irish point in November 2023; lightly raced since, but shaped encouragingly on both runs over hurdles and went very close to getting straight off the mark over fences when a neck second at Kelso (2m1f, soft) in November, shaping as though this longer trip would suit; lacks experience but high on the shortlist.

runners.comment: 6lb rise in the weights asks more, but he may not have reached his ceiling just yet.
runners.name: Fat Harry
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden over hurdles, but he's thrived since switched to fences this season, winning two of his three starts and arguably unlucky not to be 3-3 after a costly mistake at the last proved his undoing at Haydock in December; the 6lb rise demands more, but he may not have reached his ceiling just yet.

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs Stephen OFlynn & John M Flynn
runners.comment: Last season's chase form would give him claims if he's benefited from recent wind surgery.
runners.name: Dunnet Head
runners.spotlight: Out of sorts on both runs over hurdles for this stable this season, but his previous form over fences last season entitles him to respect if benefiting for recent wind surgery.

runners.comment: Justified favouritism on second run over fences and remains open to improvement; player.
runners.name: Powerofjet
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism at Newcastle (2m, good to soft) in November on second chase start, building on his reappearance effort and adding to his spring hurdles win; non-runner twice since but open to further improvement over fences now back up in trip; respected.

13:25.race_name: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Maiden Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Hdl Series Qual') (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: Promise in bumpers in Ireland; lesser performance on hurdle debut but could build on it
runners.name: Au Plaisir
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in both bumpers in Ireland (good to yielding/yielding); produced a lesser performance on recent hurdle/stable debut at Wetherby (2m, soft) but could build on that effort; not ruled out each-way.

runners.comment: Bumper winner who brings potential to this first hurdle start; player
runners.name: Bathara
runners.spotlight: Won a bumper at Warwick (2m, good) in October on second start and 11l second of five under penalty at Ascot (1m7f, good) next time, when the winner was gifted a clear lead; brings potential to this first hurdle start; player.

runners.breeder: Loic Malivet And Mme Martine Malivet
runners.comment: Showed ability on debut in a warm little race at Market Rasen and he's not discounted
runners.name: Chemoulin
runners.spotlight: 50-1 when last of five on debut at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft) last month; however, he was beaten only about 12l in what looked a warm little race and he's open to improvement; not discounted.

runners.comment: 100-1 and didn't jump with fluency when pulled up in novice hurdle at Wetherby on debut
runners.name: Colonel Jack
runners.spotlight: 100-1 and didn't jump with fluency when pulled up in novice hurdle at Wetherby (2m, soft) on last month's debut.

runners.comment: Soon behind on debut in British maiden point last February and pulled up
runners.name: Crackersnap
runners.spotlight: Soon behind on debut in British maiden point (2m4f, good to soft) last February and pulled up; hard to fancy on first rules start.

runners.comment: Placed on all three starts, most recently hurdle debut at Sedgefield, and high on the list
runners.name: Daly Boy
runners.spotlight: Placed in a point and a bumper prior to 13l second behind a Skelton odds-on shot on hurdle debut at Sedgefield (2m4f, good to soft) on Boxing Day; clear of the third on that latest start and he's high on the list today.

runners.comment: Open to improvement on this second hurdle start but he needs a sizeable chunk of it
runners.name: Eagles Cairn
runners.spotlight: Has shown some ability and he's open to improvement on this second hurdle start, but he needs a sizeable chunk of it to make an impact here.

runners.comment: 0-4 over hurdles but 1l runner-up over C&D last time and every chance he'll be bang there
runners.name: Lewisham Grove
runners.spotlight: 0-4 over hurdles but runner-up on last two starts, beaten 1l over C&D (good to soft) in November last time; every chance he'll be bang there.

runners.comment: 0-4 in points and soundly beaten on both hurdle starts; plenty to find with Daly Boy
runners.name: Loulou Madrik
runners.spotlight: 0-4 in points and soundly beaten on both hurdle starts; plenty to find with Daly Boy on their clash at Sedgefield on Boxing Day.

runners.comment: Ran three times in Irish maiden points early last year and was unable to get competitive
runners.name: Mr Ramoon
runners.spotlight: Ran three times in Irish maiden points early last year and was unable to get competitive; makes rules debut and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Placed on both hurdle starts, albeit without threatening the winner; each-way claims
runners.name: Port Station
runners.spotlight: Close-up in both bumpers and placed on his two hurdles starts (including over C&D on good to soft), albeit without threatening the winner on either occasion; holds each-way claims once more.

runners.comment: Has bumped into useful prospects when runner-up on first two hurdle starts; strong claims
runners.name: Timefortom
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m, yielding) who has bumped into useful prospects when runner-up on first two hurdle starts (2m5f/2m4f, good/soft); strong claims.

runners.comment: Looked promising in 2023; missed all of 2024 and 2025; one to watch in the betting
runners.name: Workhardplayhard
runners.spotlight: Won a point-to-point bumper in February 2023 and ran well in defeat later that year on first two hurdle starts; missed all of 2024 and 2025; interesting to see how he goes in the betting following his absence.

runners.comment: Promise in bumpers in autumn 2022 but tailed off over hurdles last month on sole run since
runners.name: Yorkshire Man Sam
runners.spotlight: Promising third in two bumpers in autumn 2022; however, tailed off at 33-1 over hurdles at Kelso last month following a mammoth absence and he needs to prove how much ability he retains.

runners.comment: Point winner; fairly encouraging 5th on h'dle debut but others have more compelling claims
runners.name: Shinealight
runners.spotlight: Won three-runner mares' maiden point in Ireland last May (3m, good); tough task in sole bumper and kept on for fairly encouraging fifth of 14 on hurdle debut at Wetherby (2m3f, good) on Boxing Day; she's a possible improver but others arrive with more compelling claims.

runners.comment: Won a point on first outing but pulled up next time and tailed off at 50-1 on hurdle debut
runners.name: Tantivy Vavoom
runners.spotlight: Dead-heated for first on debut in Irish mares' maiden point (3m, good) last April; however, pulled up next time and tailed off at 50-1 on hurdle debut at Sedgefield (2m4f, soft) in November; major turnaround required.

14:00.race_name: High Gosforth Park Golf Club Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Well handicapped; one to watch in the betting but has a very hefty absence to defy
runners.name: Donnas Double
runners.owner: D & D Armstrong Ltd & L Westwood
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on the pick of his 2023 form for Sandy Thomson; missed all of 2024 and 2025; this 10yo is one to watch in the betting on his stable debut but it's a very hefty absence to defy.

runners.comment: Clear second behind a highly progressive winner at Hexham on second chase start
runners.name: Walking On A Dream
runners.spotlight: 2m maiden hurdle winner who was a clear second behind a highly progressive winner at Hexham (2m4f, heavy) last month on his second chase start; also effective on good to soft ground; finished second in three 3m points and he's open to improvement now up in trip; firmly in calculations.

runners.comment: Form dipped at Kelso 17 days ago but creditable runs in November in first two handicaps
runners.name: Great Notions
runners.spotlight: Won hunter chase at Hexham (3m, good) last May and creditable performances in defeat in November in his first two handicaps (3m, soft); form dipped at Kelso 17 days ago but he can be in the mix if leaving that behind.

runners.comment: A return to form is needed but he's well treated and his southern trainer does well here
runners.name: Chemical Warfare
runners.spotlight: He's struggled on his last four starts but is now 3lb lower than when winning at Sedgefield (3m2f, good) last April and his southern trainer has a very healthy 24% strike-rate here; interesting, especially if backed.

runners.comment: Running respectably over fences at end of last year and not ruled out back down in grade
runners.name: Sunset Hill
runners.spotlight: Promising third at Hexham (2m4f, good to soft) in November on second chase start; fifth on next two runs but in a warm race here (2m4f, good to soft) then in a higher grade at Aintree (3m1f, good to soft); not ruled out.

runners.comment: Mixed form this season but Newmarket yard is 3-6 here; capable of a big run
runners.name: Shadows In The Sky
runners.spotlight: 10yo whose form has been mixed this season but he's edged back down the weights and his Newmarket yard is 3-6 here; capable of a big run.

runners.comment: In a competitive race for chase debut but her two half-siblings both improved for fences
runners.name: Mighty Fleur
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two bumpers and three novice hurdles; below par at Uttoxeter four weeks ago and she's in a competitive race for her chase/handicap debut, but her half-siblings The Scorpion King and River Of Joy both improved for going over fences and she's well worth a second look.

runners.comment: Inconsistent last year but Newcastle form-figures read 14121; could have a part to play
runners.name: Court At Slip
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent last year and soundly beaten at Kelso last time, but prior to that he showed spark when second at Carlisle and his Newcastle form-figures read 14121; could have a part to play now back here.

runners.comment: Below par over hurdles on last 2 runs but this point winner may benefit from going chasing
runners.name: Shadow Chaser
runners.spotlight: Merely seventh over hurdles on last two starts but before those he was second of 14 on his stable/seasonal debut at Ayr, and this point winner could be suited by today's switch to fences; not ruled out now in headgear.

runners.comment: Musselburgh fourth can be upgraded; could build on that run now going back left-handed
runners.name: Swallows Song
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who is 0-9 over hurdles and 0-5 over fences; however, last month's fourth at Musselburgh (2m7f, good to soft) can be upgraded as he jumped to the left, and he could build on that effort now going back left-handed; first-time blinkers replace the cheekpieces adopted last time.

runners.comment: 12l second on stable debut when soft ground perhaps wasn't ideal; could improve upon that
runners.name: Jamesieconn
runners.spotlight: Having been well backed he proved no match for the winner when runner-up on last month's stable/seasonal debut at Sedgefield (3m2f, soft); however, last February's chase win came on good going and he could improve upon his latest effort when back on a better surface.

runners.comment: 12yo; best finish for some time when going close at Musselburgh; runs off 7lb higher here
runners.name: Uptown Harry
runners.spotlight: 12yo who achieved his best finish for quite some time when close second at Musselburgh (2m7f, soft) last month; however, from out of the handicap today he's 7lb higher than last time and may be vulnerable.

14:35.race_name: Mini Golf At High Gosforth Park Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Unexposed 8yo but she's struggled last twice and needs a transformation back up in trip
runners.name: Merry Shuil
runners.spotlight: Promising third on hurdling debut at Carlisle (2m3f, good to soft) last winter but she's struggled in both runs since including in a Uttoxeter handicap (2m, heavy) in November; this 8yo is still unexposed but she needs a transformation back up in trip.

runners.comment: Has a patchy profile but he won this race off 2lb lower last year; in the mix
runners.name: Aquitaine Boy
runners.spotlight: Has a patchy profile but he got hampered when unseating over C&D last month and is now only 2lb higher than when winning this race (good to soft) last year; that was a brave success and he's a player if he can recapture that form.

runners.comment: 0-10 under both codes but he's a possible improver on handicap hurdle debut; watch market
runners.name: Sugar Road
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on the Flat and not much in three starts over hurdles, but he now switches to a handicap and is a possible improver on this step up in trip; needs watching in market.

runners.comment: 1-15 over hurdles for Gordon Elliott and she made a low-key start for new yard last month
runners.name: Cher Tara
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-15 over hurdles for Gordon Elliott and she made a low-key start for new yard when seventh of 13 at Musselburgh (3m, good to soft) last month; that trip may have stretched her but she's not easy to predict and others are more convincing.

runners.comment: Won at Carlisle and he's been placed there in both subsequent runs; respected
runners.name: Drop Kick
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Carlisle (2m4f, soft) in November and he's been placed as favourite there in both subsequent runs; up another 1lb but he was only beaten around 2l last time and he still has potential; key player.

runners.comment: Just 1-21 on the Flat and she needs improvement on handicap hurdle debut
runners.name: Lady Phoebe
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 21 Flat starts was off a basement mark at Musselburgh (1m5f, good; RPR 52) in August; unexposed over jumps and wasn't disgraced in Musselburgh maiden (1m7f) last month but she needs improvement upped in trip on handicap hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 6yo who ran respectably on handicap debut at Catterick; not ruled out
runners.name: Scairp Dubh
runners.spotlight: Point winner who has runner-up in his sole bumper; no impact in four hurdle runs since November but his latest sixth of 14 at Catterick (2m3f, good) was a respectable effort on handicap debut; could get involved if he can build on that and he's not ruled out.

runners.comment: Needs to get back on track but he's on a dangerous mark and is 3-3 over C&D
runners.name: Luminaries
runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdle winner but he generally struggled over fences in the autumn and was tailed off back in this sphere at Musselburgh (3m, good to soft) last month; needs to get back on track but he's 6b lower than for his last win and he's 3-3 over C&D.

runners.comment: Still early days but he needs plenty of progress with visor added on handicap debut.
runners.name: De Deli Counter
runners.spotlight: Remote fourth in an Irish point in May and he struggled in three hurdle runs (2m1f-2m4f) in the autumn; still early days but he needs plenty of progress with visor added on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Well held in both handicaps and needs to raise his game after a break; tongue-tie added
runners.name: Cap Ricochet
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who has been well held in two handicaps for his current yard and latest was at Wetherby (2m5f, good) in October; tongue-tie is now added and he needs to significantly raise his game after a break.

runners.comment: 0-13 over hurdles but he had a near miss at Musselburgh on his penultimate run; dangerous
runners.name: Leader Wing
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who is 0-13 over hurdles but he's had some close calls in handicaps including a near miss at Musselburgh (3m, soft) on his penultimate run; looks interesting if he can recapture that form and this drop back in trip should be fine.

runners.comment: Point winner but he's 0-5 over hurdles and has struggled in both handicaps; lots to prove
runners.name: Long Time Listener
runners.spotlight: Point winner but he's 0-5 over hurdles and was tailed off in two slow-ground handicaps (2m4f/2m) in November; dropped another 5lb but he has plenty to prove back up in trip

runners.comment: Tailed off in his three runs over hurdles but he could show a lot more now handicapping
runners.name: Reliance Kid
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in his three races over hurdles at up to 2m3f, but he did nearly win an Irish point and it wouldn't be a surprise if he showed lot more on this handicap debut; one to keep an eye on in market.

runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but he's struggled so far and needs a transformation
runners.name: Steel Soldier
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in three Irish points and same story at massive prices in four runs under rules; now goes handicapping back up in trip but he needs to leave his previous form well behind

runners.comment: Early days over hurdles but he needs to find more on handicap debut; tongue tied
runners.name: Junkyard Dog
runners.owner: A Sinclair David Carroll & G Gibson
runners.spotlight: 1m2f winner for Joseph O'Brien; uncompetitive in three runs for current yard but he wasn't beaten far in a juvenile hurdle at Musselburgh (1m7f, good to soft) in November; still unexposed in this sphere but he needs to find more upped in trip on handicap debut; tongue-tie added.

runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulepaire
runners.comment: Has reached the frame in two of his four handicaps and he still has potential; in the mix
runners.name: Cher Monsieur
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles but was placed in a Uttoxeter handicap (2m4f, good) in May and he reappeared with a fair fourth at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) last month; should benefit from that run and he's still unexposed at this trip; in the mix.

runners.comment: 0-10 and was disappointing last time but has possibilities if she can bounce back
runners.name: Laddie Cooper Mia
runners.spotlight: Ex-Nigel Hawke; creditable fourth in Sedgefield handicap (2m5f, good; 11-5 favourite) on stable debut in November and she may not have handled the heavy ground at Ayr (sixth of eight) last month; record is now 0-10 but she could be dangerous if she can bounce back near best.
