runners.comment: Ran well behind To Cool Forshrule on seasonal debut and not yet fully exposed over fences
runners.name: Tommy Combats
runners.spotlight: Took pretty well to fences last season (won over 1m7f at Hexham) and made pleasing reappearance when second to Too Cool Forshrule at Ayr (2m4f, soft) in November; one to consider.

runners.comment: Ayr winner in November; not quite in same form since but still enters calculations
runners.name: Too Cool Forshrule
runners.spotlight: Headed Tommy Combats on run-in to double chasing tally at Ayr (2m4f, soft) in November, his third start for Jackie Stephen; not quite in same form on either subsequent outing (2m4f/2m7f) but his mark is workable and he enters calculations.

runners.comment: Not always one to rely upon but has won his last two; headgear switched
runners.name: The Jad Factor
runners.spotlight: Not always one to rely upon but ended last season with 6l win at Kelso (2m4f, good) and rewarded persistent Patrick Wadge ride on reappearance outing at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in December; can feature if change of headgear helps to motivate him here.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 in good form over hurdles and is open to more progress on this chasing debut
runners.name: Always A Reason
runners.owner: Miss Maria D Myco & John Johnson
runners.spotlight: Ended 2025 in good form over hurdles, scoring at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) before going close at Carlisle (2m3f, soft), and this Irish point winner is open to more progress on his chase debut; cheekpieces added.

runners.breeder: Mme M J Augereau & Mr R Terriere
runners.comment: Shaped quite well over hurdles on stable debut and reverts to chasing on tempting mark
runners.name: Gandhi Maker
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and generally disappointing since spring 2024, having been in a few different yards, but shaped quite well on debut for latest new trainer, in recent 2m1f hurdle, and reverts to chasing on tempting mark.

runners.comment: Kept on for third at Hexham last spring but has poor completion record over fences
runners.name: Stylish Recruit
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over fences; seemed to be getting his act together when staying-on third at Hexham (1m7f, good) last May but returned from break with three disappointing runs in the autumn (made favourite last time); needs to get career back on track.

runners.comment: Dual chase winner last season (once over C&D); might be back at concert pitch today
runners.name: Empty Nest
runners.owner: M Blades S Morrell K Hathaway
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner last season, latterly when leading on the post over C&D (good; also suited by soft) off today's mark in March; not at best on either start this term but could now be back at concert pitch.

runners.comment: Made frame on first two starts this season; ran okay last time; back in trip; new headgear
runners.name: Emotional Roller
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on first two starts this season (3m2f/3m1f) and ran better than eventual 27l defeat might suggest when fifth at Uttoxeter (3m, good to soft) a fortnight ago; big player if combination of drop back in trip and change of headgear has desired effect.

runners.breeder: E A R L Patrick Jobert Et Al
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on handicap hurdle debut (2m); up in trip for chase debut; headgear added
runners.name: King Horse
runners.spotlight: Still unexposed after only four rules runs but was soundly beaten on handicap hurdle debut at Wetherby (2m, soft) on Boxing Day; upped in trip and fitted with cheekpieces for this chasing debut.

runners.comment: Won here in 2023 but it's a good while since he showed any worthwhile form
runners.name: Goodoldbill
runners.spotlight: Caused 33-1 surprise off lowly mark here (2m7f, soft) in November 2023 but it's a good while since he showed any worthwhile form; 4lb wrong.

15:45.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 2 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Point winner who scored easily on bumper debut at Musselburgh; key player under penalty
runners.name: Kilaro
runners.spotlight: British point winner (2m4f, good) who was sent off joint-favourite when winning easily under Paddy Barlow on bumper debut at Musselburgh (1m7f, good to soft) last month; key player under 7lb penalty.

runners.comment: Sizeable step forward to win over C&D last month on second start; respected under penalty
runners.name: Ronnie Russet
runners.spotlight: Has an attractive pedigree and took a sizeable step forward to win over C&D (good to soft) last month on his second stable start, coming nicely clear with a newcomer who was sent off favourite; respected under penalty.

runners.comment: Sedgefield debut 4th gives him something to build on and he might have an each-way shout
runners.name: Caspada
runners.spotlight: Unraced dam half-sister to useful bumper winner Dark Raven; 11-1 when fourth of six, beaten nearly 8l, on last month's debut at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft); might have an each-way shout if finding some improvement.

runners.comment: Third on sole point start; new trainer has an excellent record in bumpers this season
runners.name: Cowboy Casanova
runners.spotlight: Showed promise when third on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, soft) in November; has travelled from Wales to make his bumper debut and his new trainer has an excellent record in bumpers this season; in calculations.

runners.comment: Well beaten behind Ronnie Russet when 22-1 for last month's debut over C&D (good to soft)
runners.name: Credit Union
runners.spotlight: Related to three Flat winners but well beaten behind Ronnie Russet when 22-1 for last month's debut over C&D (good to soft).

runners.comment: Half-brother to Lunar Chief and Sagonige, who made winning debuts in bumpers for this yard
runners.name: Finbarr
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to Lunar Chief and Sagonige, who both made winning debuts in bumpers for this yard; dam also a debut bumper winner for the stable; has had wind surgery; could play a leading role on his first run.

runners.comment: Trainer 6-22 (27%) in turf bumpers here and he's therefore worth a second look on debut
runners.name: Highland Laddie
runners.spotlight: £10,000 yearling, 30,000euros 3yo; eighth foal; half-brother to winners Que Sera Sera (Flat 8.5f; RPR 75) and Marmelada (Czech 2m jumps); dam unraced half-sister to 1m4f Group 3 winner Short Pause; trainer 6-22 (27%) in turf bumpers here and he's therefore worth a second look on debut.

runners.comment: Third over C&D last month behind Ronnie Russet (who is now penalised); each-way contender
runners.name: Last Man Standing
runners.spotlight: Left last March's debut well behind when 5l third over C&D (2m1f, good to soft) last month, behind Ronnie Russet who now carries a 7lb penalty; each-way contender.

runners.comment: Half-brother to two winning jumpers but he may be one for further down the line
runners.name: Master Jack
runners.spotlight: £10,000 yearling; eighth foal; half-brother to winners Buckle Street (useful 2m-3m1f hurdle; RPR 132) and Debden Bank (2m4f-3m1f chase; 117); dam 11.6f-2m Flat winner; he may be one for further down the line.

runners.comment: Debut sixth over C&D gives him something to build on but he was behind two of these
runners.name: Mhordart
runners.spotlight: Last month's debut sixth of 11 over C&D (good to soft; 80-1) gives him something to build on but he has work to do with a couple who finished ahead.

runners.comment: Not beaten far when fourth at Carlisle but he may again find a few too good
runners.name: Red Dart
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two point-to-point bumpers and beaten only 3l when fourth of eight at 25-1 on rules debut at Carlisle (2m1f, good) in October; improvement is possible but he may again find a few too good.

runners.comment: Sold for £80,000 after Irish point win on third start; respected stable for rules career
runners.name: Valtteri Its James
runners.spotlight: Won Irish maiden point (3m, yielding) by 8l in November on his third start; sold for £80,000 12 days later; has joined a respected stable for his rules career and he could be in the shake-up.

runners.comment: Runner-up in a point and third in Catterick bumper; she's a leading contender
runners.name: Diamond White
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut on Irish mares' maiden point (3m, yielding) last March before £140,000 sale, and also showed promise when third against males in bumper at Catterick (1m7f, good to soft) last month; leading contender.

runners.comment: Tailed off at 50-1 on debut at Carlisle in November
runners.name: Khaleesi Queen
runners.spotlight: She has a useful pedigree and the first-time hood could help her settle better on this second start, but she was tailed off at 50-1 on debut at Carlisle (2m1f, soft) in November and is hard to fancy after that.

runners.comment: Half-sister to 2 winners but showed no immediate promise when tailed off at 80-1 on debut
runners.name: Maggi Breeze
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to two winners but showed no immediate promise when tailed off at 80-1 on debut at Uttoxeter (2m, good to soft) on New Year's Eve.

runners.comment: Two wins in the pointing sphere; could give a good account on rules debut
runners.name: Royal Maggs
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing S Knowles & Partners
runners.spotlight: Won British point-to-point (2m, good to soft) on debut last February and dead-heated for first in British maiden point (3m, good to firm) in May; dam is from a talented family; could give a good account on rules debut.

12:32.race_name: Racing To School Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Near-6l second in 3m hurdle here latest; chance if reproducing peak 2023-24 chasing RPRs.
runners.name: Walkinthewoods
runners.spotlight: Didn't fail for stamina upped to a stayers' trip for the first time in two years when second in a 3m hurdle here latest (good to soft), albeit beaten about 6l; 6lb higher back over fences, but nevertheless still a chance on his peak chasing form of 2023-24.

runners.comment: Every chance when unseating on recent chasing debut (2m4f, good to soft); might stay 3m.
runners.name: Staff Sergeant Len
runners.spotlight: Not bred for fences, but would have gone close on Boxing Day's Wincanton chase debut but for a final-fence unseat (2m4f, good to soft); untried at 3m, but has occasionally hinted at a need for it; chance.

runners.comment: Slow-ground Irish point winner; unseen since a pair of chase defeats in spring 2024.
runners.name: Annie Express
runners.spotlight: Late mistakes when beaten on both chase starts for Warren Greatrex in spring 2024, albeit granted conditions quicker than this slow-ground Irish point winner might prefer; long absence to defy on stable debut.

runners.comment: Weighted to strike but pulled up the last four times, despite ideal trip/ground latest.
runners.name: Haut Folin
runners.spotlight: No better for the 279-day break when registering yet another pulling up last month, despite having his preferred 3m on slow ground; 9lb below his one British winning mark now but hard to warm to; blinkers return.

runners.comment: Close up when fell at Wincanton last month (3m1f, soft); needs at least sight of the lead.
runners.name: Anytrixwilldo
runners.spotlight: Had Shot Boii comfortably held when falling two out at Wincanton last month (3m1f, soft); moderate effort since served as a fresh reminder that he needs at least a sight of the lead to be able to function.

runners.comment: 5l second at Wincanton latest (Anytrixwilldo fell ahead of him); rider claiming 2lb fewer.
runners.name: Shot Boii
runners.spotlight: Just 1-17 over fences, and last time's 5l second at Wincanton (3m1f, soft; kept on but never threatened) owed something to the late exit of Anytrixwilldo; mark unmoved but Rian Corcoran claiming 2lb fewer this time.

runners.comment: Yet to prove much ability remains since return from 14 months off.
runners.name: Imperial Pride
runners.spotlight: Triple point winner who retains lowish mileage over fences, but yet to prove much ability remains since return from 14 months off.

runners.comment: Burst a blood vessel on last month's return here (2m4f); couldn't be confident just now.
runners.name: Est Illic
runners.spotlight: Burst a blood vessel when well beaten here (2m4f) on last month's return from a major absence, and can't approach confidently just now.

runners.comment: Forgiven latest run at Uttoxeter, but couldn't entertain on season's previous efforts.
runners.name: Meranti
runners.spotlight: Can't judge too harshly on last month's pulling up in a Uttoxeter mudbath (only two of ten finished), but two efforts before that fall well short of the required here; blinkers need to prove transformative.

13:07.race_name: CLH Premier Print Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.comment: Improved for wind surgery and a tongue-tie when runner-up at Hereford; leading player.
runners.name: Catchintsavo
runners.spotlight: Progressed well in his three bumpers and left a modest hurdle debut in October behind when a close second at Hereford (extended 2m3f, good to soft; third has won since) last month, when fitted with a tongue-tie; that form makes him a leading player here now back up in trip.

runners.comment: Pulled up on last two starts and now makes stable debut with plenty to prove.
runners.name: Catch Yourself On
runners.spotlight: A glimpse of ability in bumpers but has failed to complete in three runs since switched to hurdles, pulling up on last two starts, latest when tried in blinkers; makes stable debut with plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Well held when 300-1 on hurdle debut last week and easy to look elsewhere.
runners.name: Fane Court
runners.spotlight: Won small-field Irish point in November; sent off 300-1 when beaten 74l at Taunton (2m3f, good) on hurdle/stable debut seven days ago and others make far more appeal.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Haie Neuve
runners.comment: Only shown a modest level of ability, including on last month's hurdle debut; up in trip.
runners.name: Fanny Moon
runners.spotlight: Has only shown a modest level of ability in his bumpers and was beaten 29l when last of six on last month's hurdle debut; needs to improve plenty for this step up in trip.

runners.comment: Cheekpieces need to bring a major step forward having been well held on both hurdle runs.
runners.name: Hairy Potter
runners.spotlight: Pick of his two bumper runs clearly a 14l fifth of 12 behind No Drama This End on debut, but he's failed to progress since and has been well beaten on both runs over hurdles (2m4f/2m5f) this season; cheekpieces need to bring a major step forward.

runners.comment: Worth considering with this longer trip expected to suit now switching to hurdles.
runners.name: Idaho Fire
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on sole start in a point (2m5f, good) in May and rules/bumper and stable debut in October wasn't without promise, albeit weak in the market; this longer trip should suit now switching to hurdles and he's worth considering.

runners.comment: French bumper winner but rarely seen in recent years and returns from another long layoff.
runners.name: Ironica De Thaix
runners.spotlight: Won a French bumper in 2021 but has been rarely seen since and best effort in Britain came when making a promising start for this stable, finishing an 11.5l third of eight at Ffos Las (2m4f, heavy) in February 2024 after an absence; clearly not easy to train and can only be watched back from a 714-day layoff.

runners.comment: Hard to gauge the form of his point second but commands respect on debut for top stable.
runners.name: Last Round
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred Masked Marvel 5yo who finished runner-up in his second start in an Irish point in November and subsequently sold for £55,000 later that month; hard to gauge the strength of that form but he's joined a top stable and commands respect on hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Steps up in trip for hurdle debut but others make more obvious appeal.
runners.name: La Vish
runners.spotlight: 300-1 and beaten 27l on debut in a Southwell bumper in November; steps up in trip for hurdles debut but others make more obvious appeal.

runners.comment: Leading contender on hurdle debut with the longer trip expected to bring improvement.
runners.name: Not At That Price
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred gelding who confirmed last spring's bumper promise when finishing a 2.5l second at Uttoxeter (2m, good to soft) in October, shaping as though he'd be suited by this step up in trip now turning his attention to hurdles; contender.

runners.comment: Irish point winner who makes debut in a race with not a great deal of depth; interesting.
runners.name: Seaniecon
runners.spotlight: 62,000euros purchase after winning his second start in an Irish point in May (second and fourth comfortably held in novice hurdles since); makes hurdle/stable debut in a race with not a great deal of depth; interesting if ready to go after a 236-day break.

runners.comment: Point winner in April and fit from that sphere, but more needed returning to this code.
runners.name: Shuile Warrior
runners.spotlight: Maiden point winner in April 2025, at the sixth attempt in that sphere, but showed little in a bumper and one run over hurdles in 2023-24; more likely required on his return to this code.

runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late P J Corbett
runners.comment: Related to a couple of point winners but probably best watched on a belated debut.
runners.name: Asifbymagic
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; dam ran once in points, half-sister to point winners Upton Legend and Upton Sovereign; probably best watched on a belated debut.

13:42.race_name: CLH Premier Print Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.comment: Second in two Irish points last spring but struggled when 200-1 for hurdle debut
runners.name: Aberfeldy
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two Irish points last spring but struggled when 200-1 for 2m Newbury hurdle in November and remains best watched.

runners.comment: Pulled up on last month's hurdle debut at Plumpton
runners.name: Crest Of Valour
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in Fontwell bumper (good to soft) in October but pulled up over hurdles at Plumpton (2m4f, soft) last month.

runners.comment: Bought for £30,000 after finishing third on Irish point debut in April; rules debut today
runners.name: Drumlee Orders
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to fair hurdler Too Much To Ask; bought for £30,000 soon after finishing third on Irish point debut last April (yielding ground); probably best watched on rules debut.

runners.comment: Fifth in a point bumper last March; makes rules debut after 291-day absence
runners.name: Georgemani
runners.spotlight: Stoutly bred 5yo from a good family; just a respectable fifth in good-ground point bumper last March and makes rules debut after a 291-day absence; probably one for further down the line.

runners.comment: Bumped into a useful one when clear second at Leicester in November; leading contender
runners.name: Island Bridge
runners.spotlight: Promising fouth in good Cheltenham novice (3m, good) on seasonal/hurdle debut in October and bumped into a useful one when clear second at Leicester (2m4f, soft) the following month; leading contender.

runners.comment: Made the frame in three big-field Irish maidens last spring; now with Venetia Williams
runners.name: Kara Sacre
runners.spotlight: Won on Irish point debut in April 2024 and made the frame in three big-field Irish maiden hurdles (2m-2m4f) for Paul Nolan last spring, albeit his latest run was slightly disappointing; makes stable debut after 229-day break but has strong claims if fully tuned up.

runners.comment: Bought for £115,000 in October, having shown clear promise in both bumpers; hurdle debut
runners.name: Mondouiboy
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in heavy-ground Sandown bumper for Harry Derham last February and also displayed significant promise in big field at Punchestown festival (yielding) in May; changed hands for £115,000 in October and should have a good future over hurdles for new stable.

runners.comment: Made quite promising rules debut but his latest run was a backward step; needs improvement
runners.name: My Own Lovely Lee
runners.spotlight: Kept on for respectable fourth on rules debut at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft) in November but raced too freely and was below that form when fifth (behind Tao Enki) at Leicester (2m4f, soft) last month; improvement required.

runners.comment: Ran okay in both bumpers but was tailed off when switched to hurdling
runners.name: Parliamo
runners.spotlight: Ran okay in two bumpers last season but was tailed off when 150-1 for hurdle debut at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft) in November (had surgery soon afterwards); not the most obvious answer here.

runners.comment: Looked promising in Irish points/bumpers; soundly beaten on stable/hurdle debut
runners.name: Passing Diamond
runners.spotlight: Dual Irish point winner; made the frame in two good-ground Irish bumpers in early part of this season but was soundly beaten on last month's stable/hurdle debut and needs to leave that run a long way behind.

runners.comment: Second of five in interesting Market Rasen novice last month; each-way claims at least
runners.name: Plains Drifter
runners.spotlight: Slightly disappointing in his second bumper but belied 33-1 odds when second of five in quite interesting novice hurdle at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft) last month and won't be far away if able to build on that performance here.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras DEnki
runners.comment: Launched hurdling career with two encouraging runs in autumn but has a bit to find here
runners.name: Tao Enki
runners.spotlight: Launched hurdling career with two encouraging runs in the autumn, more recently when third (albeit well held) at Leicester (2m4f, soft), but has a bit to find with the principals here.

14:17.race_name: Ludlow Racecourse Annual Members Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Promising novice hurdler last season; well held when refusing/unseating on chase debut
runners.name: I Am The Moon
runners.spotlight: Promising as a novice hurdler last term but made disappointing seasonal/chase debut at Fakenham (2m4f, soft; first-time cheekpieces) last month, well held before final-fence refusal/unseat; has a point to prove.

runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie DOssau Et Al
runners.comment: In good form when last seen in the autumn; had wind op during short break
runners.name: Another Folly
runners.spotlight: Made all to open account at Stratford (2m6f, good to soft) in October, his eighth chase, and also ran well when second to very progressive rival at Warwick (2m4f, soft) the following month; had wind op during 57-day break; can give this a good shot.

runners.comment: On a very good mark now but both runs since long layoff have been disappointing
runners.name: Bolsover Bill
runners.spotlight: Began 2024 with two 2m3f Exeter wins under Victoria Malzard and is now very well handicapped on that form but returned from long layoff with two disappointing runs towards end of 2025 (hurdle/chase) and needs a revival.

runners.comment: Refused to race last month but held every chance before last-fence fall on latest outing
runners.name: Move With The Beat
runners.spotlight: Five-time point winner who returned to racing under rules with satisfactory hurdle run in November; blotted his copybook when refusing to race on penultimate appearance but held every chance before last-fence fall at Taunton (2m7f, good) last month and is a player if all goes well here.

runners.comment: Just 1-8 over hurdles but ran well on seasonal debut; a possible if he takes to chasing
runners.name: The Grey Man
runners.spotlight: Just 1-18 over hurdles but gave good account when keeping-on fourth of 13 on seasonal debut at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) in October and has possibilities if he takes well to fences at the first attempt.

runners.comment: Yet to strike form after three runs this season and not yet proven over this far
runners.name: Lucky Lugger
runners.spotlight: Now 3lb lower than when winning five-runner Uttoxeter chase (2m, soft) last February but yet to strike form after three starts this season and not yet proven over this far.

runners.breeder: David Lumet & Dr V Catherine Lumet
runners.comment: Ran fairly well at Sedgefield on Boxing Day but others appeal more; sports new cheekpieces
runners.name: Jaitroplaclasse
runners.spotlight: Made all in small-field Newton Abbot chase (2m, good to soft) in September and put a below-par run behind him when respectable third at Sedgefield (2m, good to soft) on Boxing Day but others appeal more all the same; moves back up in trip and sports first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Kept on for third over 2m in first two chases and makes appeal on first attempt at 2m4f
runners.name: Zoeman
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo who kept on for third in his first two chases, the latter at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) last month; could quite plausibly have untapped potential over 2m4f and features prominently in calculations.

runners.comment: Pulled up over hurdles in October, after a long absence; looks too risky on chasing debut
runners.name: Black Occ
runners.owner: P Conway T Lewis & G Wilson
runners.spotlight: Pulled up over hurdles in October, after a long absence, and now 0-6 under rules; sports first-time cheekpieces for this chasing debut and has some Irish pointing experience to call upon but still looks too risky.

runners.comment: Safely held in both chases in the autumn but still needs a look in the betting
runners.name: Owl Of Athens
runners.spotlight: Rewarded heavy market support and displayed sudden improvement when winning off lowly hurdle mark at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft) just under a year ago; lacked fluency and was safely held in both chases in the autumn but still needs a look in the betting.

runners.comment: 2m chase winner last season and made encouraging reappearance over hurdles in October
runners.name: Night Jet
runners.spotlight: Scored on chasing debut at Leicester (2m, soft) last February and made quite encouraging seasonal return over hurdles in October; off for another 11 weeks since but is fine over 2m4f and remains unexposed over fences.

runners.comment: Regressive mare who was pulled up last time and is 7lb out of the weights here
runners.name: Stopherandgo
runners.spotlight: Regressive mare who was pulled up when returned to fences and tried in first-time cheekpieces (retained) at Wincanton (3m1f, soft) last month; drops back in trip with tongue-tie added here; 7lb out of the weights.

14:52.race_name: Join "Windsor Blue" Race Club Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.breeder: E A R L De Cordelles Et Al
runners.comment: Progressed well over fences/hurdles last season and commands respect after a break.
runners.name: Demoiselle Kap
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a productive spell last season after joining this stable, winning four of her six starts over hurdles and fences, and ending the campaign on a high with a 5l second in a class 3 handicap chase off this mark at Kempton (2m2f, good) in April; commands plenty of respect if returning from a break in similar form back over hurdles.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who returned to form here last month and should be competitive again.
runners.name: Tour Ovalie
runners.spotlight: Progressed well over hurdles last season and, after a slow start this campaign, returned to near best when winning over C&D in December and produced another solid effort back up in the weights when third at Newbury (2m, good to soft) 17 days ago; likely to give another good account.

runners.comment: Capable of better now switching to handicaps following a promising return last month.
runners.name: Ufouria
runners.spotlight: Displayed a fair level of ability for Paul Nolan in Ireland and, after being sold for £18,000, shaped promisingly on debut for this stable at Hereford (2m, good to soft), travelling strongly in a first-time tongue-tie before a lack of a recent run told; better can be expected here on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Consistent mare who has been holding her form well this term, but likely needs more.
runners.name: Ip Up
runners.spotlight: 3-18 over hurdles; continues to run consistently well and has reached the frame on all three starts this season, but she probably needs to find that little bit more to add to her score.

runners.comment: Unexposed mare who shaped promisingly on handicap debut last month after an absence.
runners.name: Railway Bell
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who made all in a Uttoxeter mares' maiden (2m, good) on hurdle debut in November 2024; made an encouraging reappearance at Wincanton (1m7f, soft) last month on handicap debut and it wouldn't be a surprise should she figure here with that run behind her.

runners.comment: Has yet to transfer her French form to these shores, so probably best watched at present.
runners.name: Golden Falls
runners.spotlight: Signed off in France with a couple of good runs over 2m1f on soft at Dieppe, but has failed to match that level in two runs since joining this stable for 60,000euros in the summer; albeit highly tried on the first occasion; eased in class again and has her age allowance, but needs to show more.

runners.comment: Has posted some respectable efforts since winning in October, but she likely needs more.
runners.name: Getmetothemoon
runners.spotlight: Stratford (2m, good) winner in October off 4lb lower and possibly bettered that when a close third at Wincanton (2m4f, soft) last month, before appearing to find the drop back to 2m a little sharp at Taunton last time; more likely needed again.

runners.comment: Unexposed 6yo; drop back in trip should help but she does appear to be on a tough mark.
runners.name: Jammy Jay
runners.spotlight: Has produced two respectable efforts since switching to handicaps this season, most recently when fourth over 2m4f at Aintree last month, though that did appear to stretch her stamina; dropping back in trip should help, but she does appear to be on a tough mark.

runners.comment: Drops back in trip after a break and isn't yet fully exposed; interesting contender.
runners.name: Ask Me Another
runners.spotlight: Won a Hereford juvenile hurdle (2m, soft) in April 2024 and made a bright start to handicaps when second at Huntingdon (2m4f, good to soft) after a break in January, though a lesser effort followed; drops back in trip now returning from a break and isn't yet fully exposed; interesting contender.

runners.comment: First and second in Sandown's military races in 2025; may prefer somewhere more testing.
runners.name: Fil dAriane
runners.spotlight: First and second in Sandown's military races last term (soft, good to soft) before converting an easy task in his members race at Didmarton; all rules and point wins have been gained around more testing tracks than Ludlow, and it's five years since his one winning seasonal reappearance.

runners.comment: C&D winner last season; some tough tasks of late, but better expected at Fakenham latest.
runners.name: Frere dArmes
runners.spotlight: Player on the form of 2025's hunter chase wins over C&D (good to soft) or 2m1f at Stratford (good); a number of tough tasks (one a Grade 2 hurdle) have contributed to some ragged form figures since, but last time's Fakenham flop is harder to forgive; rider 0-1 under rules (0-8 points).

runners.comment: Absence since all-the-way 3m3f Stratford win in May is no issue; may not be for catching.
runners.name: Gracchus De Balme
runners.spotlight: Landed two of British hunter chasing's three big prizes (Aintree, 2m5f and Stratford, 3m3f) during a 2024-25 season founded on consistency at a high level rather than progression; match-fitness is a given for his yard's runners and, with stamina to spare, he may not be for catching.

runners.comment: 2-4 record here includes a C&D handicap win (soft); may leave seasonal return run behind.
runners.name: Java Point
runners.spotlight: Underwhelming seasonal/stable debut in a Sandown handicap latest, but returns to Ludlow for the first time since 2023 with a course record of 2-4, including a C&D win on soft (RPR 135); interesting.

runners.comment: Won a C&D match last May (good); jumping right to his detriment most starts since.
runners.name: Shanagh Bob
runners.spotlight: C&D match last May (good, RPR 128) gave him his only chase win to date; habit of jumping right too great to ignore since, including when twice second in points lately, so a return to a clockwise track is timely.

runners.comment: 2m (good), 3m (good to soft) and 2m4f (heavy) winner the last thrice; many bases covered.
runners.name: St Cuthberts Cave
runners.owner: G & S Capper J Sherratt S Anderson
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of a well-run Uttoxeter handicap chase for Simon Edwards in September (good), and burgeoning versatility advertised by subsequent open point wins over 3m (good to soft) and 2m4f (heavy); jumping issues of summer's Irish chasing form look well behind him; player.

runners.comment: 7l behind Gracchus De Balme at Haydock last term; solid return in a Cheltenham handicap.
runners.name: Take All
runners.spotlight: 7l to find with Gracchus De Balme on last term's Haydock form, but was keeping him honest in a point earlier in the season before running out at the last; 2m4f hunter winner on sole previous Ludlow run, and November's Cheltenham handicap fourth (3m1f, heavy) rated a really solid return.

runners.comment: Leicester hunter winner last year (2m4f, heavy); pulled up in Aintree Foxhunters' latest.
runners.name: Pyleigh Court
runners.spotlight: Owner-breeder's patience was rewarded with Leicester maiden hunter chase win last year (2m4f, heavy); never better than midfield behind Gracchus De Balme at Aintree, and a few look too good again here.

runners.comment: Double between the flags in early 2025, but tougher tasks on last two starts; opposed.
runners.name: Blagthebookies
runners.spotlight: Double between the flags in early 2025, but tougher tasks on last two starts; lots to find with these on their respective rules bests.

runners.comment: Second on last four point starts, but no threat in hunter chases; losing run is extending.
runners.name: Frontal Assault
runners.owner: Henry G Bailey & Camilla Stowell Davies
runners.spotlight: Second in each of his last four point starts, only one of them as high as open class; among the non-finishers with Blagthebookies at Cheltenham in May when last seen in this sphere; overlooked.

16:02.race_name: Racing TV Fillies' "Junior" National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Game win on Doncaster debut, and she oughtn't mind conditions turning as soft again.
runners.name: The Procrastinator
runners.spotlight: Slugged it out gamely for a 1l success on November's Doncaster debut (2m, soft; pair clear) under Luke Scott; vulnerable conceding weight all round, but may cope better than most if the rain sets in.

runners.comment: Pedigree more encouraging for chasing than bumpers; yard 0-6 in bumpers so far this term.
runners.name: Chocolate Cosmos
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to Graded novice chase winner Kylemore Lough with two more in Ottowa and Calling Brave elsewhere in the pedigree, so best days likely lie a little way ahead; yard 0-6 in bumpers so far this term.

runners.comment: Dam's immediate family is rich in bumper winners; yard had bumper winner last week.
runners.name: Crystalate
runners.spotlight: 5,000euros daughter of a maiden pointer from an immediate family rich in bumper winners (one Listed); yard bagged an 18-1 bumper winner last week and has done much of its winning in this division latterly.

runners.comment: Ran green in a junior hurdle latest; previous bumper second has received form boosts.
runners.name: Graceful Glance
runners.spotlight: October's Stratford debut second (2m, good to soft) looks better form now, the winner all but defying a penalty next time and fourth Tenter Le Tout a Grade 2 hurdles winner since; bit too green to seal the deal switched to hurdling last time, but obvious claims if wiser now.

runners.comment: One half-sister won a bumper for this trainer, whose 2025-26 bumper strike-rate is 24%.
runners.name: LAmandine
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to two bumper winners (one between the flags, the other at Sedgefield for this trainer); definite appeal for a yard currently operating at a 24% strike-rate in this sphere for 2025-26.

runners.breeder: Mill House Stud & Mr N Farrell
runners.comment: Staying-on sixth on Hereford debut (2m, soft), albeit still beaten 21l; more needed.
runners.name: Millady
runners.spotlight: 16-1, got the hang of things steadily to post a staying-on sixth on her Hereford debut (2m, soft), albeit still beaten 21l; more needed.

runners.comment: Granddam was 2-2 in hurdles around here; dam was pretty moderate 1m6f/2m Flat winner.
runners.name: Oceanides
runners.spotlight: Owner-bred out of a 1m6f/2m Flat winner (RPR 59), whose own dam was 2-2 in hurdles around here; still not quite the appeal of some.

runners.comment: One place ahead of Wait For This latest, meeting traffic; chance if finding more still.
runners.name: Semele
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs A E Pakenham
runners.spotlight: Probably value to have beaten Wait For This by further when fourth at Newbury latest given some traffic problems, though by no means unlucky not to win; chance if able to step up a little further on that effort.

runners.comment: Out of a French 9.5f Flat/2m1f hurdle-winning sibling of a Listed 1m scorer; respected.
runners.name: Stars Align
runners.spotlight: 48,000euros yearling out of a French 9.5f Flat/2m1f hurdle-winning sibling of a Listed 1m scorer; respected, for all that the yard's formerly formidable strike-rate in Ludlow bumpers has been diluted by a few winless seasons here.

runners.comment: Niece of high-class Handstands; dam won bumper and hurdles for same trainer; check market.
runners.name: Steal A Glance
runners.spotlight: Dam (a half-sister to high-class chaser Handstands) won five on soft or heavy for the Honeyballs, including a hurdle here and a bumper on stable debut; tongue tie applied on debut; check market.

runners.comment: Staying-on fifth on debut despite refusing to settle; goes closer if helping herself more.
runners.name: Wait For This
runners.spotlight: From a gifted family and posted a respectable near-8l fifth on debut at Newbury last month (2m, good to soft), keeping on despite an initial refusal to settle; entitled to build on that.
